title: Patient Complains About Pain After Procedure
summary: A patient calls angrily saying the procedure caused severe pain. Listen fully before explaining; protect trust and guide appropriate care.

scene.setting: A patient calls angrily saying the procedure caused severe pain. You may feel defensive or concerned; the hidden risk is minimizing their pain and damaging trust. The decision point is protect clinical pride vs protect patient trust.

beats.narration: The call is emotional. The decision point is explain quickly or listen fully first.

dialogue.speaker: doc
dialogue.line: I hear that you're in a lot of discomfort. Tell me more—when did it start, how severe? Then we'll figure out the next step.

choices.label: Explain that some pain is normal and give aftercare instructions.

steps.step: Ask open questions first; clarify severity and duration; then provide context and next steps.

leader_lines: Before I explain—how would you describe the pain? When did it start?
Then I'll give you context and next steps.
questions: How do you listen before explaining?
scripts.closing_line: Ask first; clarify severity; then context and next steps.

choices.label: Listen fully, assess carefully, and then respond with next steps.

steps.step: Listen fully; assess (severity, duration); respond with next steps.
Chart note on call and pain level; callback if symptoms persist; clear escalation path.

leader_lines: I'm listening. Tell me what you're feeling and when it started.
Based on that, here's what we do next.
questions: How do you document and follow up?
When do we offer an in-person check?
scripts.closing_line: Chart note; callback if needed; clear escalation.

choices.label: Suggest they may be exaggerating and remind them of consent.

steps.step: Validate without agreeing: 'I hear this is really difficult'; assess before concluding; never imply exaggerating.

leader_lines: I hear that this is really difficult. Let's figure out what's going on.
questions: How do you validate without agreeing?

choices.label: Offer to have them come in for a quick check at no charge.

steps.step: Offer check when pain is severe or patient is anxious; assess in person; adjust as needed.

leader_lines: I want to see you so we can check. Can you come in?
When do you offer an in-person check?
questions: As part of standard post-op protocol?
scripts.closing_line: Offer check when severe or anxious; document; follow up.

system_prompts.nudge: Listening first strengthens trust before solving.
system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you protect your pride or their trust?

outcomes.message: The patient may have felt invalidated. Trust can collapse.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with listen-first?
How do you validate without agreeing?

outcomes.message: The patient felt heard. Trust preserved or repaired; care was appropriate.
reflection_questions: How do you document and follow up?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I listened fully before responding to a concern. (1-5)
